items.content_html:
Part of #9218.

This PR fixes up live samples in the CSS part of the Learning area so that they will work in Markdown: this means removing any <div> elements and adding the occasional heading so we can have an ID to reference in EmbedLiveSample.

Note that I started fixing some notes in here, too, but then decided it would be better to do that in a separate PR.
items.title: [Markdown] [Learn] Fix CSS live samples

items.content_html:
Summary

This change includes:

  • making navigator.clipboard the "primary" approach given that document.execCommand is deprecated (addressing #4864)
  • provides a summary of the limitations with navigator.clipboard in the introduction
  • adds a note that the use of document.execCommand in hidden fields (addressing #1807)

Motivation

To make the article more comprehensive and current.

Related issues

  • #4864
  • #1807

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Improvements to the working with the clipboard guide

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding SubmitEvent and FormDataEvent to the list of those inheriting from Event

Motivation

These two are currently missing from the Event list. Per HTML Spec, SubmitEvent and FormDataEvent inherit from the main Event and should be listed.

Supporting detail

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#the-submitevent-interface

Related issues

Metadata

This PRâ€¦
-->

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Adding SubmitEvent and FormDataEvent

items.content_html:
Reviewer @jpmedley

Joe, this interface has an event handler which does not appear to be in the IDL. I've left mention of it on the main interface page, however I'm assuming we don't want to document it right now? Let me know, I can:

  • leave this as it is, with a mention but no docs.
  • document it as per spec.
  • remove the mention from the main page.

I also fixed my own typo on the main API page which was causing a broken link.
items.title: Adds ImageTrack

items.content_html:
The example in the old version:

Notice in these examples that the left-to-right order of evaluation is still preserved. In other words, the order in which the operators evaluate has changed, but the order in which the operands evaluate has not. For example in this code:

a() * (b() + c())

The function a will be called before the function b, which will be called before the function c.

We have another description mentioning the evaluation order becomes right-to-left etc.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Expressions_and_Operators (Return value and chaining)
, so it's extraordinary unnatural to mention as if it's to be "left-to-right order of evaluation is still preserved" in a general principle of JavaScript:

In the old version, the behavior of the example code arises due to eager evaluation of JavaScript, which should be substantially another off-topic here. As the operator illustrated, + or * is arithmetic operators, so readers naturally consider that the topic is told in the context of algebra.

Here, at least, there are 2 independent concepts:

  • Grouping operator ( ) that follows the rule of mathematics in the form of dependency graph (the main target topic here)
  • Eager evaluation of JavaScript (off-topic, if really needed, substantial explanations are required to clarify the relation to the main target topic here)

Readers should not be Implicitly misguided into confusion of these independent concepts.

Once an example code that behavior is due to the another substantial off-topic concept is presented, the document should explicitly clarify the concept, or should not provide such a confusing example from the first.

The new version is provided to resolve these problems.
items.title: Update Grouping operator ( )

items.content_html:
I initially got shortly confused when reading the sentence If compareFunction(a, b) returns a value > than 0, sort b before a. because I read the part returns a as that it returns the value a.
In this case it just meant 'a value' as in 'any' function return value, not the value of a.

Since there is an argument also called a this can be initially confusing to read.
I looked at ways to word it differently but in the end I think a table most clearly expresses at a glance what is about.

Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: create table for `compareFunction` return values

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

Fixes #9311

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

You can easily obtain the target ray corresponding to the targetRaySpace from within the drawing handler for a given frame using XRFrame's getPose() method

Above description clearly says getPose() method belongs to XRFrame, but the code sample

let targetRayPose = frame.session.getPose(primaryInput.targetRaySpace, viewerRefSpace);

Calls getPose() from frame.session which seems to refer to XRSession.

Anything else that could help us review it

  • @JakeJustLearning Please kindly review whether the changes I made are enough.
items.title: fix: fix typo in sample code under WebXR doc Target ray space.

items.content_html:
This is first part of self.reportError() docs, which is delivered in FF93 as part of #8608.

Edited. It is a global (Api/reportError) linked from top level Window and WorkerGlobalScope

I am still waiting on information needed for the interactive example: mdn/interactive-examples#1919

Also see, need advice on how the browser key works in this case.
items.title: Add window.reportError

items.content_html:
Addresses issue: #4776

  • Create a new landing page for ARIA roles.
  • Complete most of the document structure, landmark, live region, window, and abstract roles (basically, still working on widget roles.

Additional issues addressed:

  • Fixes #3188: link now working
  • Partial fix for #1938 - page exists, but widgets are being done next
  • Fixes #4281: link now works
  • #4319: example in description
  • #4525: addressed some issues (added it to list of pages needing to be edited: it's 1.3, so wasn't in the priority list for this first PR)
  • #7445: removed screen reader support from all pages as we are not doing that... yet.

Note the pages with "needscontent" tag and {{draft}} only had an auto md conversion. Each of those will be edited and in individual PRs
items.title: ARIA Roles

items.content_html:
Fixes #3427

This demo was incredibly confusing as it mixed up flex (which ignores the second value) and grid. Plus the grid tracks were the same size as the items therefore the second value appeared not to be working even in grid.

I have split it into two, and also added an explanation before each demo. I think that is better.
items.title: Making the place-items demo less confusing

Bumps actions/github-script from 4.1 to 5.

What's Changed

Full Changelog: actions/github-script@v4.1.0...v4.1.1

Commits
  • 441359b Merge pull request #193 from actions/joshmgross/v5
  • 4e1175c Update licenses

  • 5e5d515 Upgrade to the latest version of Octokit
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: chore(deps): bump actions/github-script from 4.1 to 5
